Disclosing the error to the patient and her parents is the appropriate course of action, as it provides them with information, allows them to ask questions, and may also help build trust in the healthcare provider-patient relationship. Additionally, discussing strategies to prevent similar errors in the future demonstrates accountability and commitment to patient safety.
